DOCNAME: CASE OF BOTSKALEV AND ROSTOVSKAYA AND OTHER "PRIVILEGED PENSIONERS" CASES v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial;Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are pensioners who live in LOC . Before retirement they used to work in hazardous industries . They had a dispute with a pension authority about the scope of their privileged pensions and appealed to the GPE 's district and town courts .

CARDINAL . In DATE the courts held for the applicants and ordered the pension authority to recalculate the pensions . The courts based their findings on ORG . In DATE these judgments became binding and were executed .

CARDINAL . On the pension authority 's request , in DATE the district and town courts quashed their judgments due to discovery of new circumstances . The courts found , in particular , that the judgments had ignored the interpretation of ORG given by ORG in DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants ' cases were remitted for a rehearing and subsequently dismissed .
